headerEntries: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 26, +18 to hit with spell attack):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Orcus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Orcus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master of Undeath
traits.text: Orcus can cast animate dead (at will) and create undead (3/day). He chooses the level at which the spells are cast, and the creatures created by them remain under his control indefinitely. Additionally, he can cast create undead even when it isn't night.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.text: Orcus wields the .

multiAttack.text: Orcus makes three Wand of Orcus, Tail, or Necrotic Bolt attacks.

attacks.name: Wand of Orcus
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d8 + 11) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

attacks.name: Necrotic Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) necrotic damage.

special.name: Conjure Undead
special.text: While holding the , Orcus conjures whose combined average hit points don't exceed 500. These creatures magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of Orcus and obey his commands until they are destroyed or until he dismisses them as an action.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Orcus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23): At will: detect magic once per day: time stop 3 times per day: dispel magic

special.name: Wand Spellcasting
special.text: While holding the , Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell save DC 18), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn: At will: animate dead (as an action), blight, speak with dead

actions.name: Attack
actions.text: Orcus makes one Tail or Necrotic Bolt attack.

actions.name: Creeping Death (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Orcus chooses a point on the ground that he can see within 100 feet of him. A cylinder of swirling necrotic energy 60 feet tall and with a 10-foot radius rises from that point and lasts until the end of Orcus's next turn. Creatures in that area have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Orcus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):

spellcasting.name: Wand Spellcasting
headerEntries: While holding the , Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell save DC 18), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn:

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Niv-Mizzet fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Locus of the Firemind
traits.text: Niv-Mizzet can maintain concentration on two different spells at the same time. In addition, he has advantage on saving throws to maintain concentration on spells.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Niv-Mizzet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master Chemister
traits.text: When Niv-Mizzet casts a spell that deals damage, he can change the spell's damage to cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.text: Niv-Mizzet is a 20th-level Izzet spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 26, +18 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave, unseen servant 2nd level (3 slots): blur, enlarge/reduce, flaming sphere, hold person, scorching ray 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, lightning bolt, slow 4th level (3 slots): confusion, dimension door, fabricate 5th level (2 slots): conjure elemental, polymorph, wall of fire, wall of force 6th level (1 slots): chain lightning, disintegrate, true seeing 7th level (1 slots): project image, reverse gravity, teleport 8th level (1 slots): control weather, maze, power word stun 9th level (1 slots): prismatic wall

multiAttack.text: Niv-Mizzet makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d4 + 9) slashing damage.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: Niv-Mizzet exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 (26d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Cantrip
actions.text: Niv-Mizzet casts one of his cantrips.

actions.name: Tail Attack
actions.text: Niv-Mizzet makes a tail attack.

actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Niv-Mizzet beats his wings. Each creature within 15 feet of him must succeed on a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (2d4 + 9) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. Niv-Mizzet can then fly up to half his flying speed.

actions.name: Dracogenius (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Niv-Mizzet regains a spell slot of 3rd level or lower.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Niv-Mizzet is a 20th-level Izzet spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 26, +18 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede Mammon's darkvision.

traits.name: Fiendish Regeneration
traits.text: Mammon regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Mammon only dies if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and is unable to regenerate.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Mammon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Mammon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: Mammon uses Fearful Gaze, then makes four attacks using Tail Swipe, Constrict, or a combination of the two.

attacks.name: Tail Swipe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape DC 21). While grappled, the creature also has the restrained condition, and Mammon can't make Tail Swipe attacks.

special.name: Fearful Gaze
special.text: Mammon focuses his gaze in a 90-foot cone in front of him. Each creature of his choice within the cone must make a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw, taking 19 (3d12) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save have the frightened condition until the end of their next turn.

special.name: Constrict
special.text: Mammon tightens his grip around a creature he has grappled. The target takes 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

special.name: Golden Gaze
special.text: Mammon attempts to turn one creature he can see within 60 feet of him into solid gold. The target must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's flesh begins to harden, and it has the restrained condition. A restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of each turn. If it successfully saves three times, the effect ends. If it fails three times, it turns to gold and now has the petrified condition. Successes and failures don't need to be consecutive.

reactions.name: Pain Tax
reactions.text: As a reaction to taking damage, Mammon causes the attacker's valuables to glow red hot. This deals 3 (1d6) fire damage to the attacker for every 100 gold (or equivalent in gems, jewelry, and other coinage) that it currently carries.

actions.name: Change Form
actions.text: Mammon changes his form into that of a pit fiend, maintaining his statistics but losing his actions. He gains the actions and mobility of a pit fiend, including its weapon, and maintains his legendary actions and lair actions. Mammon's serpentine abilities can still recharge while he is in pit fiend form. If Mammon is already a pit fiend, this action changes him back into his serpentine form.

actions.name: Golden Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Mammon recharges Golden Gaze.

actions.name: Call Underling (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Mammon summons an allied horned devil in an unoccupied space that he can see.

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Armor of Ice
traits.text: Levistus is always entombed in ice. The ice provides 100 temporary hit points. While Levistus has these temporary hit points, he has vulnerability to fire damage. If Levistus starts his turn with no temporary hit points from the ice, he regains 100 temporary hit points.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede Levistus's darkvision.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Levistus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Levistus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sub-zero
traits.text: Cold damage dealt by Levistus ignores resistances and immunities.

multiAttack.text: Levistus makes three Touch of Stygia or Ice Bolt attacks. He can replace one of the attacks with Blizzard (if available).

attacks.name: Touch of Stygia
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or have the stunned condition for 1 minute. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 1 hour.

attacks.name: Ice Bolt
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) cold damage.

special.name: Blizzard
special.text: Levistus chooses a point he can see within 300 feet of him. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw. Targets take 13 (3d8) force damage plus 13 (3d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Levistus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23): At will: Cone of Cold, Darkness, Ice Storm, Wall of Ice

reactions.name: Counterspell
reactions.text: As a reaction to a creature he can see casting a spell, Levistus can attempt to prevent the casting. Levistus makes an Intelligence check (+7) against a DC of (10 + spell level). On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

actions.name: Amnesia
actions.text: Levistus selects a stunned creature that he can see. The creature must succeed on a DC 23 Charisma saving throw or Levistus erases a specific memory from the target. The memory must be one that the target experienced in the last 24 hours and that lasted no more than 10 minutes. The memory can only be restored with a Remove Curse or a Greater Restoration spell.

actions.name: Froststrike
actions.text: Levistus makes an Ice Bolt attack. On a hit, the target falls and has the prone condition.

actions.name: Call Underling (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Levistus summons an allied ice devil in an unoccupied space that he can see.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.text: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, deafened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

multiAttack.text: Demogorgon makes two Tentacle attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Gaze.

attacks.name: Tentacle
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

special.name: Gaze
special.description: Demogorgon turns his magical gaze toward one creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):

options.name: 1–2: Beguiling Gaze
options.text: The target is stunned until the start of Demogorgon's next turn or until Demogorgon is no longer within line of sight.

options.name: 3–4: Confusing Gaze
options.text: The target suffers the effect of the confusion spell without making a saving throw. The effect lasts until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon doesn't need to concentrate on the spell.

options.name: 5–6: Hypnotic Gaze
options.text: The target is charmed by Demogorgon until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon chooses how the charmed target uses its action, reaction, and movement.

special.text: Demogorgon turns his magical gaze toward one creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Demogorgon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23): At will: detect magic, major image 3/day each: dispel magic, fear, telekinesis 1/day each: feeblemind, project image

actions.name: Gaze
actions.text: Demogorgon uses Gaze and must use either Beguiling Gaze or Confusing Gaze.

actions.name: Tail
actions.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)

Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 19) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

special.name: Breath Weapon
special.text: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

special.name: Mass Telekinesis
special.text: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a DC 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.text: The cradle is a container for the scion of Memnor. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body dissipates into cloud wisps. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.text: The cradle doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.text: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The cradle makes three Slam or Wind Javelin attacks in any combination.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) thunder damage.

attacks.name: Wind Javelin
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

special.name: Vortex
special.text: The cradle conjures a vortex of wind at a point it can see within 90 feet of itself. The wind vortex is a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on that point. Each creature other than the cradle in that area must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 71 (11d12) bludgeoning damage and has the restrained condition within the vortex. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder. The vortex lasts until the start of the cradle's next turn. A creature with the restrained condition falls prone when the vortex ends. A creature with the restrained condition can use its action to try to escape the vortex. The creature makes a DC 19 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. On a successful check, the creature escapes and moves 3d6 × 10 feet away from the vortex in a random direction.

reactions.name: Thunderclap
reactions.text: Immediately after taking damage, the cradle unleashes a thunderclap in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. All other creatures in that area must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw or take 18 (4d8) thunder damage and have the deafened condition for 1 minute.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede Baalzebul's darkvision.

traits.name: Fiendish Regeneration
traits.text: Baalzebul regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Baalzebul dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Lord of Flies
traits.text: Insects don't attack Baalzebul, and he can issue orders to them.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Baalzebul fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Baalzebul has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Stench of the Slug
traits.text: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of Baalzebul must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or have the poisoned condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature is immune to this stench for 1 hour.

multiAttack.text: Baalzebul uses Heart of Pestilence (if available), then makes three Slam attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

special.name: Pungent Eruption
special.text: Baalzebul causes refuse and caustic liquid to spill from the ground at a point he can see within 300 feet. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw. Targets take 36 (8d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save have the poisoned condition for 1 minute.

special.name: Heart of Pestilence
special.text: Baalzebul channels pestilence into his body, sickening creatures within 50 feet that can see him. Sickened creatures must make a DC 21 Charisma saving throw, followed by a DC 21 Constitution saving throw. Failing the Charisma save makes a creature have the frightened condition, while failing the Constitution save makes a creature weak. While weakened, a creature deals half damage on melee attacks. Both effects last for 1 minute or until a greater restoration spell or similar is cast.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Baalzebul casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24): At will: animate dead, darkness, detect evil and good, detect magic, dispel evil and good, hallow, hold monster, suggestion, teleport, true seeing 1/day each: symbol (pain or insanity), wish

bonusActions.name: Displace
bonusActions.text: Baalzebul magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

actions.name: Pummel
actions.text: Baalzebul makes a Slam attack.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.text: Baalzebul uses Displace.

actions.name: Insect Gorge (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Baalzebul disgorges a swarm of biting flies at a point he can see within 300 feet of himself. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 21 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 44 (8d10) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The biting flies persist for 1 minute, or until Baalzebul uses this ability again. Creatures that enter the flies' area or end their turn inside it must repeat the saving throw.

actions.name: Call Underling (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Baalzebul summons an allied bone devil in an unoccupied space that he can see.

traits.name: Cycle of Rebirth
traits.text: If the dragon dies, its soul coalesces into a steely egg and teleports to a random plane of existence. The egg is immune to all damage and hatches into a time dragon wyrmling after 1d100 years. The dragon retains all memories and knowledge it gained in its previous life.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

special.name: Time Breath
special.text: The dragon exhales a wave of shimmering light in a 90-foot cone. Nonmagical objects and vegetation in that area that aren't being worn or carried crumble to dust. Each creature in that area must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage, it has the poisoned condition, and other creatures have resistance to all damage it deals. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves.

special.name: Time Gate
special.text: The dragon conjures a 20-foot-diameter, circular portal in the space between its horns or in an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself. The portal links to a precise location on any plane of existence at a point in time up to 8,000 years from the present, whether past or future. The portal lasts for 24 hours or until the dragon's concentration ends (as if concentration on a spell). The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is transported to the destination, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal. Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals created by the dragon from opening in the rulers' presence or anywhere within their domains.

reactions.name: Reactive Rend
reactions.text: After using Legendary Resistance or in response to being hit by an attack roll, the dragon makes one Rend attack.

reactions.name: Slow Time
reactions.text: Immediately after a creature the dragon can see ends its turn, the dragon targets a creature it can see within 90 feet of itself that is weakened by its Time Breath. Until the weakened effect ends on the target, its speed becomes 0, and its speed can't increase.

reactions.name: Time Slip
reactions.text: The dragon halves the damage it takes from an attack made against it, provided it can see the attacker. The dragon can then immediately teleport, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the colossus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Towering Terror
traits.text: Any enemy outside the colossus that starts its turn within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the enemy's next turn. If the enemy's saving throw is successful, it is immune to this colossus's Towering Terror for the next 24 hours.

multiAttack.text: The colossus makes three attacks—one with its slam and two with its eldritch turrets—and then uses Stomp.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the colossus can push the target up to 20 feet away from it.

attacks.name: Eldritch Turret
attacks.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +18 to hit, range 300 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is knocked prone.

special.name: Stomp
special.text: The colossus stomps one of its feet at a point on the ground within 20 feet of it. Any creature in a 20-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on this point must succeed on a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage and fall prone. Until the colossus uses its Stomp again or moves, the creature is restrained. While restrained in this way, the creature (or another creature within 5 feet of it) can use its action to make a DC 26 Strength check. On a success, the creature relocates to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the colossus and is no longer restrained. Structures, as well as nonmagical objects that are neither being worn nor carried, take the same amount of damage if they are in the cylinder (no save).

special.name: Incinerating Beam
special.text: The colossus fires a beam of light in a 150-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this beam is disintegrated, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Velomachus fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: Velomachus makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (1d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 6 (1d12) thunder damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (1d6 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is knocked prone.

special.name: Battle Tide Breath
special.text: Velomachus exhales thunderous sound in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 25 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 (7d12) force damage and 45 (7d12) thunder damage and is pushed up to 20 feet in a horizontal direction of Velomachus' choice. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. Objects that aren't being worn or carried take the damage and are pushed as if they were creatures that failed the saving throw.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Velomachus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: 1/day each: contact other plane (as an action, contacting a long-dead spirit), divination, move earth, wall of force

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Velomachus makes one Claw attack.

actions.name: Chaotic Flow (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Velomachus moves up to half her flying speed. If a creature hits or misses her with an opportunity attack during this move, the attacker takes 19 (3d12) thunder damage.

actions.name: Repeating History (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Velomachus magically summons 1d4 statue mascots in unoccupied spaces she can see within 60 feet of herself. The spirit statues obey her commands and take their turns immediately after hers. Any creature, other than a spirit statue or Velomachus, is restrained if it starts its turn within 5 feet of one or more of these spirit statues. This restrained condition lasts until the end of the creature's turn. These spirit statues disappear after 10 minutes, when Velomachus dies, or when she uses this action again.

headerEntries: Velomachus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

1e: contact other plane (as an action, contacting a long-dead spirit)

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
traits.text: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The scion makes one attack using Lava Blade or Lava Ball, as well as two Slam attacks.

attacks.name: Lava Blade
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) fire damage.

attacks.name: Lava Ball
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 26 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) force damage.

special.name: Lava Wave
special.text: The scion emits a wave of lava from its blade, hands, or mouth in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 60 (11d10) fire damage and has the restrained condition from being embedded in hardening rock. A creature can make a DC 25 Strength (Athletics) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and 40 hit points, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

bonusActions.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
bonusActions.text: The scion moves up to its speed and then sends a shock wave through the ground in a 60-foot-radius circle centered on itself. Each creature on the ground in that area that is concentration must succeed on a DC 26 Constitution saving throw or lose concentration.

bonusActions.name: Incendiary Smoke
bonusActions.text: The scion causes smoke and white-hot embers to billow from its skin, filling a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself that moves with it. While the scion's skin billows smoke, ranged attacks against the scion are made with disadvantage. A creature that moves into the smoke for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) fire damage. The scion's skin stops billowing smoke after 1 minute, when the scion dies, or when the scion uses this bonus action to stop the smoke.

traits.name: Aura of Servile Avians
traits.text: Any evil creature with a natural fly speed and a CR of 20 or less must make a DC 21 Wisdom saving throw if they attempt to attack Pazuzu. A failed save means their action is wasted and the attack fails. On a successful saving throw the target is immune to this effect in the future.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Pazuzu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Pazuzu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: Pazuzu's weapon attacks are magical.

multiAttack.text: Pazuzu makes two Greatsword or Talon attacks.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Talon
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

special.name: Breath Weapons
special.text: Pazuzu exhales poisonous acid in a 100-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Every creature hit by the acid must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this breath weapon melts and is disintegrated.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Pazuzu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24): At will: astral projection, blight, charm person, detect evil and good, dispel magic, hallow, insect plague, telekinesis, teleport, wind walk once per day: wish 2/day each: dominate person, hypnotic pattern, plane shift (only itself and willing creatures)

bonusActions.name: Dispel
bonusActions.text: Pazuzu casts dispel magic, automatically dispelling any spell of 6th level or lower on the target.

bonusActions.name: Hasted Greatsword
bonusActions.text: Pazuzu uses his magic greatsword to grant him the following abilities until the start of his next turn. Pazuzu's speed is now doubled, he gains a +2 bonus to AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and gains one additional Greatsword attack.

actions.name: Disarm
actions.text: Pazuzu attempts to knock a weapon out of a target's hand. He makes a Greatsword attack and if it hits, the target does not take damage but instead must make a DC 22 Strength saving throw. If the target fails the saving throw, the targeted weapon flies 10 feet away in a random direction.

actions.name: Lethal Leap
actions.text: Pazuzu attacks once with his Greatsword or Talon and then may fly up to 60 feet away. Pazuzu's movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Pazuzu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24):

2e: plane shift (only itself and willing creatures)

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The marut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the marut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The marut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: The marut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

multiAttack.text: The marut makes two Unerring Slam attacks.

attacks.name: Unerring Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 60 force damage, and the target is pushed up to 5 feet away from the marut if it is Huge or smaller.

special.name: Blazing Edict
special.text: Arcane energy emanates from the marut's chest in a 60-foot cube. Every creature in that area takes 45 radiant damage. Each creature that takes any of this damage must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the marut's next turn.

special.name: Plane Shift (3/Day)
special.text: The marut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The marut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma saving throw or be banished to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil. 3 times per day: plane shift

spellcasting.name: Plane Shift (3/Day)
headerEntries: The marut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The marut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a DC 20 Charisma saving throw or be banished to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The champion makes two Leeching Blade attacks and uses Hollow Void.

attacks.name: Leeching Blade
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 33 (6d10) cold damage, and the champion regains 10 hit points.

special.name: Hollow Void
special.text: The champion summons a hungering rift around a creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The creature must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 49 (11d8) force damage and has the stunned condition until the start of the champion's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this effect, the creature dies, and its body crumbles to dust.

bonusActions.name: Step into Nothing
bonusActions.text: The champion, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, has the invisible condition and teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of itself. The champion remains invisible until the start of its next turn or immediately after it deals damage.

actions.name: Crush
actions.text: The champion unleashes a burst of crushing force on a creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a DC 22 Strength saving throw or take 14 (4d6) force damage and have the prone condition.

actions.name: Fearsome Pursuit
actions.text: The champion moves up to its speed or commands its mount to move up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

actions.name: Nullify (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The champion emits a magic wave in a 60-foot cone. Every spell of 5th level or lower ends on creatures and objects of the champion's choice in that area.

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Charm Aura
traits.text: When a creature moves to be within 120 feet of Glasya, they must succeed on a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw or have the charmed condition, treating Glasya as an ally, until they leave the aura. A creature that succeeds the saving throw is immune to this effect for 1 hour. Whenever a charmed creature takes damage, they may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

traits.name: Dominating Presence
traits.text: Glasya deals an additional 13 (2d12) psychic damage when attacking a charmed creature, and her attacks don't break charms.

traits.name: Fiendish Regeneration
traits.text: Glasya regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Glasya dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and is unable to regenerate. If Glasya is killed, her body slowly regenerates, returning to life 9 (2d8) weeks later.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Glasya fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Glasya has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: Glasya makes four attacks using Scourge of Shadow, Necrotic Grasp, or a combination of the two. She can replace one of the attacks with Mesmerizing Gaze.

attacks.name: Scourge of Shadow
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +20 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d4 + 12) slashing damage, plus 5 (2d4) necrotic damage. This attack scores a critical on a roll of 18, 19, or 20.

special.name: Necrotic Grasp
special.text: Glasya summons necrotic hands to grope and claw at a creature she can see within 90 feet of her. The target must make a DC 25 Constitution saving throw, taking 20 (2d10 + 9) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

special.name: Mesmerizing Gaze
special.text: Glasya focuses her gaze in a 60-foot cone in front of her. Each creature of her choice within the cone must make a DC 23 Charisma saving throw or have the charmed condition until the end of their next turn. While charmed, creatures automatically fail saving throws from abilities used by Glasya and move to be as close to her as possible.

special.name: Deathly Exclamation
special.text: Glasya targets a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must make a DC 25 Constitution saving throw, taking 61 (7d8 + 30) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid killed by this ability rises at the start of Glasya's next turn as a zombie permanently under her command.

actions.name: Whip
actions.text: Glasya makes a Scourge of Shadow attack.

actions.name: Disorient (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Glasya casts Confusion (30-foot-radius, spell save DC 25), but only lasting until the end of Glasya's next turn.

actions.name: Call Underling (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Glasya summons an allied erinyes in an unoccupied space that she can see.

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.text: When a creature starts their turn within 120 feet of Fierna, they must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until they leave the aura. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 1 hour.

traits.name: Fiendish Regeneration
traits.text: Fierna regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Fierna dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and is unable to regenerate.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Fierna fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Fierna has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Princess of Hellfire
traits.text: Fire conjured by Fierna becomes Hellfire. It ignores resistances and immunities to fire damage, deals double damage to creatures vulnerable to fire or necrotic damage, can't be extinguished through any means, and is capable of melting stone or igniting inflammable objects.

multiAttack.text: Fierna makes three attacks using Flame Blade, Mote of Flame, or a combination of the two.

attacks.name: Flame Blade
attacks.text: Melee Spell Attack: +20 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) fire damage.

special.name: Mote of Flame
special.text: Fierna targets a creature she can see within 90 feet of her. The target must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (3d8 + 9) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Wreath of Flames
reactions.text: When hit by a melee attack and Fierna can see her attacker, she covers herself in Hellfire, and the attacker takes 13 (3d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Blade
actions.text: Fierna makes a Flame Blade attack.

actions.name: Conjure Hellfire (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Fierna chooses a point she can see within 150 feet of her. All creatures in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Call Underling (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Fierna summons an allied spined devil in an unoccupied space that she can see.

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.text: The cradle is a container for the scion of Surtur. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body hardens and crumbles to ash. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.text: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The cradle makes three Slam or Hurl Lava attacks in any combination.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

attacks.name: Hurl Lava
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 10 (3d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

special.name: Erupting Breath
special.text: The cradle exhales flames and volcanic gases in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 55 (10d10) fire damage and has the poisoned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature poisoned in this way can make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonusActions.name: Lava Geyser
bonusActions.text: The cradle causes lava to erupt from a point on the ground it can see within 120 feet of itself. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius, 50-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d6) fire damage.

name: Colossus
languages: understands Celestial and Common but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The colossus can't shape-shift.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.text: If the colossus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The colossus has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The colossus makes three attacks, using Slam or Radiant Ray in any combination.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +18, reach 20 ft. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) Bludgeoning damage, and the colossus pushes the target up to 20 feet straight away from itself.

attacks.name: Radiant Ray
attacks.text: Ranged Attack Roll: +18, range 300 ft. Hit: 22 (4d10) Radiant damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

special.name: Divine Beam
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 26, each creature in a 300-foot-long, 10-foot-wide Line . Failure: 65 (10d12) Radiant damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this beam disintegrates into dust, leaving behind any magic items it was wearing or carrying.

actions.name: Smite
actions.text: The colossus makes one Radiant Ray attack.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.text: The colossus moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks, and it can make one Slam attack at any point during that move.

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Deep Wounds
traits.text: All damage dealt by Belial can only be restored through magical means.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.text: Magical darkness doesn't impede Belial's darkvision.

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.text: When a creature starts their turn within 120 feet of Belial, they must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or have the frightened condition until they leave the aura. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 1 hour.

traits.name: Fiendish Regeneration
traits.text: Belial regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Belial dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Belial fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Belial has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: Belial makes three attacks using his Ranseur of Torture.

attacks.name: Ranseur of Torture
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage, and the target must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's movement speed is reduced by 5 feet until the end of their next turn. This penalty can stack.

special.name: Walls of Phlegethos
special.text: Belial creates a wall of fire on a solid surface within 120 feet of him. The wall is 20 feet high and 1 foot thick, and Belial can make the wall up to 60 feet long or create a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter. The wall is opaque and lasts until Belial dismisses it. When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that ends its turn inside the wall, or within 5 feet of it, must repeat the save.

special.name: Symbol of Insanity
special.text: Belial draws a magic symbol at a point he can see within 120 feet of him. All creatures within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the symbol must make a DC 25 Intelligence saving throw. Targets take 45 (10d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save immediately use their reaction to make a melee attack against a random creature within their reach, then move their full movement in a random direction.

reactions.name: Pleasure in Pain
reactions.text: As a reaction to taking damage, Belial immediately regenerates half the damage he took.

actions.name: Ranseur
actions.text: Belial makes a Ranseur of Torture attack.

actions.name: Eruption (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Belial causes molten stone to erupt from a point he can see within 90 feet of him. All creatures within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw. Targets take 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Call Underling (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Belial summons an allied horned devil in an unoccupied space that he can see.

resistances.condition: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.text: Any creature hostile to Bel that starts its turn within 20 feet of him must make a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw unless Bel is incapacitated. If the save fails, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Bel's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Bel fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Bel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: Bel attacks twice with his Greatsword and once with his Tail.

attacks.name: Greatsword
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being held or worn, it catches fire.

attacks.name: Tail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or have the stunned condition until the end of its next turn.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Bel casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24): At will: Detect Magic, Fireball 2/day each: Dispel Magic, Hold Monster, Mirror Image, Mislead, Raise Dead, Teleport, Wall of Fire 1/day each: Imprisonment, Meteor Swarm

actions.name: Fireball
actions.text: Bel casts Fireball.

actions.name: Tactical Edge (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Roll a d6 for Bel. The number rolled on the die is subtracted from the next attack roll made against Bel or an ally of his choice within the next minute.

actions.name: Summon Ice Devil (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Bel magically summons an ice devil with an ice spear (as described in the ice devil's entry in the Monster Manual). The ice devil appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Bel, acts as Bel's ally, and can summon other devils if it has such power. The ice devil remains until Bel dies or until he dismisses it with an action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Bel casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Yeenoghu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Yeenoghu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: Yeenoghu makes three Flail attacks.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (2d12 + 9) force damage. If it's his turn, Yeenoghu can cause the target to suffer one of the following additional effects, each of which he can apply only once per turn

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) acid damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Yeenoghu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17): At will: detect magic once per day: teleport 3/day each: dispel magic, fear, invisibility

bonusActions.name: Rampage
bonusActions.text: When Yeenoghu reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, he moves up to half his speed and makes one Bite attack.

actions.name: Charge
actions.text: Yeenoghu moves up to his speed.

actions.name: Swat Away
actions.text: Yeenoghu makes one Flail attack. If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet in a straight line away from Yeenoghu. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also knocked prone.

actions.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Yeenoghu makes a separate Bite attack against each creature within 10 feet of him.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Yeenoghu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Tanazir fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: Tanazir makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (1d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is addled by recursive thoughts, reducing its speed to 0 until the start of Tanazir's next turn.

special.name: Diminution Breath
special.text: Tanazir exhales a weakening equation in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (13d6) force damage and 45 (13d6) psychic damage and is weakened until the start of Tanazir's next turn. While weakened, it has disadvantage on the following rolls that rely on Strength: attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

special.name: Teleport
special.text: Tanazir teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 100 feet of herself.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Tanazir casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24): 1/day each: divination, enlarge/reduce, mirage arcane (as an action), polymorph, scrying (as an action), seeming

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Tanazir makes one Claw attack.

actions.name: Fold Space (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Tanazir uses Teleport, and each other creature within 20 feet of the space she left must succeed on a DC 24 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet closer to the center of that space and take 16 (3d10) force damage.

actions.name: Fractal Refraction (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Tanazir magically summons 1d4 fractal mascots in unoccupied spaces she can see within 120 feet of herself. The fractals obey her commands and take their turns immediately after hers. While any of these fractals remain, attack rolls made against Tanazir have disadvantage. A summoned fractal disappears after 1 minute, when it or Tanazir dies, or when she uses this action again.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tanazir casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24):

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
traits.text: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The scion makes one Ice Axe and two Slam attacks, or it makes two Glacier Throw attacks.

attacks.name: Ice Axe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) force damage plus 18 (4d8) cold damage.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) force damage.

attacks.name: Glacier Throw
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

special.name: Glacial Upheaval
special.text: The scion digs its hands into the ground at a point it can see within 30 feet of itself and launches a magically conjured mass of ice into the air. Each creature other than the scion in a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) cold damage and is pushed vertically to the top of the cylinder, at which point the creature falls. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder with no additional effects. At the start of the scion's next turn, a mass of ice plummets to the ground on a point the scion can see within 60 feet of the point the scion dug its hands into. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must succeed on a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw or take 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) cold damage.

bonusActions.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
bonusActions.text: The scion moves up to its speed and sends a shock wave through the ground in a 60-foot-radius circle centered on itself. Each creature on the ground in that area that is concentration must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw or lose concentration.

traits.name: Captivating Presence
traits.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Rakdos must make a DC 25 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by Rakdos for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from him. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to Rakdos's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

traits.name: Cruel Entertainment
traits.text: When a creature Rakdos can see within 60 feet of him is reduced to 0 hit points, Rakdos gains 25 temporary hit points.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Rakdos fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Rakdos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: Rakdos's weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Innate Spellcasting
traits.text: Rakdos's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 25). He can innately cast hellish rebuke (at 5th level) at will, requiring no material components. At will: hellish rebuke

multiAttack.text: Rakdos makes two attacks with his Curtain-Call Scythe or his claws.

attacks.name: Curtain-Call Scythe
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) fire damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) slashing damage.

actions.name: Sadistic Revelry
actions.text: Each creature within 60 feet of Rakdos that is his ally or is charmed by him must use its reaction to move up to half its speed toward the creature closest to it that it can see, provided it isn't already within 5 feet of that creature. It then must make one melee attack against that creature if it is able to do so.

actions.name: Scythe (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Rakdos uses Curtain-Call Scythe.

actions.name: Touch of Pain (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Rakdos makes a claw attack against one creature within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 25 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can't maintain concentration on a spell or any other effect that requires concentration. The poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rakdos's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 25). He can innately cast hellish rebuke (at 5th level) at will, requiring no material components.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Graz'zt fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Graz'zt has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

multiAttack.text: Graz'zt makes two Wave of Sorrow attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

attacks.name: Wave of Sorrow (Greatsword)
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) force damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage.

special.name: Teleport
special.text: Graz'zt teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Graz'zt casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23): At will: charm person, detect magic, dispel magic 3/day each: darkness, dominate person, telekinesis, teleport 1/day each: dominate monster, greater invisibility

bonusActions.name: Change Shape
bonusActions.text: Graz'zt transforms into a form that resembles a Medium Humanoid or back into his true form. Aside from his size, his statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

reactions.name: Negate Spell
reactions.text: Graz'zt tries to interrupt a spell he sees a creature casting within 60 feet of him. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, Graz'zt makes a Charisma check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

actions.name: Abyssal Magic
actions.text: Graz'zt uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

actions.name: Attack
actions.text: Graz'zt makes one Wave of Sorrow attack.

actions.name: Dance, My Puppet!
actions.text: One creature charmed by Graz'zt that Graz'zt can see must use its reaction to move up to its speed as Graz'zt directs.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Graz'zt casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):

traits.name: Alien Mind
traits.text: If a creature tries to read Dyrrn's thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Dyrrn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: Dyrrn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.text: Dyrrn regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If Dyrrn takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Dyrrn dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Teleport
traits.text: As a bonus action, Dyrrn can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

multiAttack.text: Dyrrn makes one Tentacle Whip attack and uses its Corruption once. Dyrrn can replace its Tentacle Whip attack with Extract Brain if it has a creature .

attacks.name: Tentacle Whip
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 23), pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of Dyrrn, and must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends. Dyrrn can't use the same tentacle whip on another target until this grapple ends. Dyrrn has two tentacle whips.

attacks.name: Extract Brain
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated creature grappled by Dyrrn. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Dyrrn kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

special.name: Corruption
special.text: Dyrrn targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or take 22 (4d6 + 8) necrotic damage and become corrupted for 1 minute. A corrupted creature's flesh twists in alien ways. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, its speed is reduced by half, and if it tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence check or the spell fails and is wasted. The corrupted creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Tentacle Whip
actions.text: Dyrrn makes one attack with its Tentacle Whip.

actions.name: Spawn Aberration (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Dyrrn regurgitates an intellect devourer in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The intellect devourer is under Dyrrn's control and acts immediately after Dyrrn in the initiative order.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Dyrrn magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 23 Intelligence saving throw or take 30 (5d8 + 8) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Awakening of the Scion
traits.text: The cradle is a container for the scion of Thrym. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body shatters into shards of ice. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.text: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.text: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

multiAttack.text: The cradle makes two Slam or Hurl Icicle attacks.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) cold damage.

attacks.name: Hurl Icicle
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 23 Strength saving throw or have the prone condition.

special.name: Freezing Breath
special.text: The cradle exhales a blast of frost in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) cold damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 hit points, the target drops to 1 hit point instead and has the petrified condition, turning into a frozen statue. If the statue takes bludgeoning damage, it shatters, killing the frozen creature. If the statue would take fire damage, it instead takes no damage and thaws, ending the petrification.

bonusActions.name: Chilling Mist
bonusActions.text: The cradle magically conjures a cloud of chilling mist that fills a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 90 feet of itself. The mist spreads around corners. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 28 (8d6) cold damage and be unable to use reactions until the start of its next turn. The mist vanishes at the end of the cradle's turn.

traits.name: Avatar of Bhaal
traits.text: When the ravager drops to 0 hit points, its form fractures. Within the next 24 hours, it will reappear in its slayer form within 2d6 miles of where the ravager form fell.

traits.name: Cull the Weak
traits.text: When the ravager damages a creature with a melee attack and the target is left with 20 or fewer remaining hit points, the creature must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or be reduced to 0 hit points.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.text: The ravager is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If the ravager fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.text: The ravager has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.text: The ravager's Claw, Bite, and Spines attacks are magical.

traits.name: Spiked Hide
traits.text: At the start of each of its turns, the ravager deals 16 (3d10) piercing damage to any creature grappling it or being grappled by it.

multiAttack.text: The ravager makes one Bite attack and then either two Claw attacks or two Spines attacks.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. Large or smaller creatures damaged by this attack are grappled (escape DC 20) and the ravager can't make another Bite attack until this grapple ends.

attacks.name: Spines
attacks.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) piercing damage. If the target fails a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, they are stunned until the end of their next turn.

actions.name: Detect
actions.text: The ravager makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

actions.name: Spiky Carapace
actions.text: The ravager flares its numerous spines and they elongate. Any creature within 5 feet of the ravager must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Smash (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: The ravager smashes downwards with great force, causing a violent implosion. Any creature within 10 feet of the ravager must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the saving throw are also pulled 5 feet towards the ravager. The noise produced by this attack can be heard up to 1 mile away.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.text: If Beledros fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.text: Beledros doesn't require air, food, or drink.

multiAttack.text: Beledros makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (1d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 6 (1d12) necrotic damage.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (1d6 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is knocked prone.

special.name: Decaying Breath
special.text: Beledros exhales decaying energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw, taking 39 (6d12) necrotic damage and 39 (6d12) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that takes damage from the breath can't regain hit points until the start of Beledros's next turn.

special.name: Miasmal Flow
special.text: Beledros becomes a swirling cloud of green mist and can move up to half her flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then resumes her true form. During this movement, she can move through creatures and objects as if they were . If she moves through a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of its next turn. If Beledros ends this move inside an object, she takes 5 (1d10) force damage and is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: Beledros casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability: 1/day each: greater restoration, mass cure wounds, plant growth, revivify, speak with dead

actions.name: Claw
actions.text: Beledros makes one Claw attack.

actions.name: Miasmal Flow (Costs 2 Actions)
actions.text: Beledros uses Miasmal Flow.

actions.name: Teeming with Life (Costs 3 Actions)
actions.text: Beledros magically summons 1d4 pest mascots in unoccupied spaces she can see within 60 feet of herself. The pests obey her commands and take their turns immediately after hers. Any creature, other than a pest, takes 9 (2d8) poison damage if it starts its turn within 5 feet of one or more of these pests. When one of these pests drops to 0 hit points, Beledros regains 9 hit points. These pests disappear after 10 minutes, when Beledros dies, or when she uses this action again.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Beledros casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
traits.text: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

multiAttack.text: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Scorching Ray (level 3 version).

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: Melee Attack Roll: +17, reach 15 ft. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

special.name: Fire Breath
special.text: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 24, each creature in a 90-foot Cone . Failure: 91 (26d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

special.name: Spellcasting
special.text: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks): At will: Command (level 2 version), Detect Magic, Scorching Ray (level 3 version) 1/day each: Fireball (level 6 version), Scrying

actions.name: Commanding Presence
actions.text: The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast Command (level 2 version). The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Fiery Rays
actions.text: The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast Scorching Ray (level 3 version). The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Pounce
actions.text: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one Rend attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
